cyclone.name: FRANKLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 290 miles south of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to lift northward toward Hispaniola Tuesday–Wednesday and then turn north-north-east into the southwest Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: Dominican Republic north and east coasts; Turks and Caicos Islands
weather_observation.warning_coast: Dominican Republic entire south coast; Haiti entire south coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Hispaniola, southern Bahamas/Turks & Caicos, eastern Caribbean including Puerto Rico for heavy rain
weather_observation.wind: Brief gusts to tropical-storm force (mainly in squalls) possible late Tuesday–Wednesday with low overall probability (≤10%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for San Juan; surge forecast limited to 1–3 ft near Hispaniola landfall area
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands from Franklin could drop 2–4 inches over Puerto Rico, locally higher up to 6 inches, causing ponding and localized flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated flash flooding and minor mudslides in mountainous terrain; possible short-term marine/harbor disruption from squally showers
